definition: J.R.R. Tolkien (1892-1973), British philologist and author of fantasy fiction such as Lord of the Rings 魔戒
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee
variant of 爾|尔[er3]
thus/so/like that/you/thou
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: I grew up in England and the curriculum had Tolkien in it.
sentences.chinese: 我生长在英格兰和课程曾在它托尔金。

sentences.english: The Darkest of all Tolkien's tales.
sentences.chinese: 托尔金笔下最黑暗的传说。

sentences.english: The king, you knew Tolkien would be showing up here sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 当然你知道的，托尔金早晚会出现在这里。

sentences.english: Tolkien's world is one of heroes and villains, in which good always wins in the end.
sentences.chinese: 托尔金的世界里善恶分明，正义最后总是胜利的一方。

sentences.english: The barrel scene continues to change Tolkien's work throughout the second film.
sentences.chinese: 托尔金笔下桶的场景在第二部电影里继续被改编。

sentences.english: Except that JRR Tolkien denied having created the word.
sentences.chinese: 只可惜，托尔金否认自己创造了这个单词。
